alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 10:55PM EST until January 14 at 1:10PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Barclay Messerly Road south of the Warren Airport in Braceville floods. Knowlton Road will be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM EST Friday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.6 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 04/13/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM EST.
